bibl.title: On a More Precise Definition and Dating of a Coptic Miniature Representing Christ.

Coptic Society, Literature and Religion from Late Antiquity to Modern Times. Proceedings of the Tenth International Congress of Coptic Studies, Rome, September 17th-22nd, 2012 and Plenary Reports of the Ninth International Congress of Coptic Studies, Cairo, September 15th-19th, 2008. I; - II

bibl.note: Miniature representing Christ kept at the Hermitage Museum. Monastery of St. Michael in the Fayyum?, 10th century. Above the head of Christ the word Emmanouel is partly visible, the reverse bears 13 lines in Coptic containing the name of Shenute.
bibl.seg: Olga V. Osharina, On a More Precise Definition and Dating of a Coptic Miniature Representing Christ.

Paola Buzi, Alberto Camplani & Federico Contardi (edd.), Coptic Society, Literature and Religion from Late Antiquity to Modern Times. Proceedings of the Tenth International Congress of Coptic Studies, Rome, September 17th-22nd, 2012 and Plenary Reports of the Ninth International Congress of Coptic Studies, Cairo, September 15th-19th, 2008. II = Orientalia Lovaniensia Analecta. 247 (Leuven - Paris - Bristol, CT, 2016) pp. 1597-1609, 10 figg.

Miniature representing Christ kept at the Hermitage Museum. Monastery of St. Michael in the Fayyum?, 10th century. Above the head of Christ the word Emmanouel is partly visible, the reverse bears 13 lines in Coptic containing the name of Shenute.
